Nguyễn Bảo Trung

Hi there! I'm Trung, a math lover, a coder and an autodidact from Vietnam. I love to learn something new everyday. I write about what I've learned in an accessible and intuitive way because I do agree with Einstein that "If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough.".

Recent read books view all

  • I'm reading Hands-On Machine Learning with Scikit-Learn, Keras, and Tensorflow: Concepts, Tools, and Techniques to Build Intelligent Systems — Aurélien Géron.
  • I'm reading Factfulness: Ten Reasons We're Wrong About the World – and Why Things Are Better Than You Think — Hans Rosling, Ola Rosling, Anna Rosling Rönnlund.
  • my choice The Godfather — Mario Puzo.
  • The ABC Murders — Agatha Christie. When Alice Asher is murdered in Andover, Hercule Poirot is already on to the clues. Alphabetically speaking, it's one down, twenty-five to go.
  • Inside the Minds of Serial Killers: Why They Kill — Katherine Ramsland.
